conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a true 3D cutaway: extruded walls with thickness, angled/isometric-like camera, and ceiling/roof removed to reveal interior volumes.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Clear wall height/thickness and readable interior volumes; cutaway is clean. Minor issues: some wall joins/corners and opening edges look simplified/softened.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall exterior footprint and main open-plan zoning roughly match (large living area left, kitchen/right zone with counters, dining bump-out). However, several internal partitions/room separations (foyer/closets/pantry/playroom boundaries) appear simplified or partially misplaced, and door/window placements do not consistently map to the 2D plan.

interior_elements.notes: Kitchen counters/island and a few built-ins are present, but most room-specific furniture/fixtures are sparse or missing (e.g., living/dining furnishings and clear bathroom fixtures), reducing ability to confirm room identities.

visual_clarity.notes: Clean presentation and good contrast; geometry is mostly readable. Some openings and partitions blend due to uniform material and simplified detailing.

detected_errors.description: Internal layout fidelity is reduced: several partitions/room separations (closet/foyer/pantry/playroom delineations) appear simplified or not fully aligned with the 2D plan.
Doors/windows are not consistently verifiable against the 2D plan; some openings appear missing or repositioned.
Furniture/fixtures are minimal, limiting confirmation of room identities and functional zoning.
Uniform material and simplified edges reduce clarity of partitions and opening geometry.

summary: A genuine 3D cutaway with solid volumetric rendering, but with moderate internal-partition and opening-placement mismatches versus the 2D plan.
